                                    CARLOS GUERINI  
 
Address:            4, St. Aidan ’s Close, Radcliffe , Manchester, M26 1YJ                                                     
Telephone:       0044 (0) 161 725 9738

PERSONAL PROFILE  
A dynamic and inspiri ng Professional, who has  passion and drive to achieve business results.  Inter -linked with 
excellent customer service skills, use d to working wi th multi million pound sales targets, and good experience in 
dealing with people on all levels (from Owners & Directors to  Shop floor personnel). Used to p roviding factual and 
honest feedback to move the business opportunity forward to its next goal, whils t strengthening the business 
relationships. I enjoy  covering both International and Domestic markets with the variety of associated tasks that are 
required.  
I speak  5 languages including English  and I am looking for a position that allows me to use my management  and 
business development  skills to a greater degree and use my languages to their full potential.  I have always enjoyed 
the job  roles and the variety of tasks that are required. I feel my past experience gives me a good background to 
apply myself t o new challenges.  
 
 
 
 
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE  
 
June  17 – Present (Luxfer Graphic Arts ) 
Business  Development Manager  (EMEA ) 
 
Luxfer Graphic Arts/Magnesium Elektron specializes in developing, manufacturing and supplying magnesium 
products to technology industries w orldwide. 
 
Main Responsibilities  
 
• Demonstrated exemplary leadership in spearheading and overseeing business development and sales 
operations spanning the EM EA market , consistently surpassing annual order intake targets while 
aligning closely with the company's strate gic objectives and operational framework . 
• Conducted meticulous market analysis, competitor research, and customer insights to inform precise 
order forecasts, thereby nurturing a robust prospect pipeline that translated into heightened sales 
opportunities  and bolstered revenue generation . 
• Played a pivotal role in cross -functional collaboration with product planning teams, providing invaluable 
insights into customer requirements, market dynamics, and business case analyses, thus empowering 
strategic decis ion-making and driving continuous enhancement of product offerings . 
• Provided dedicated support and strategic management for key customer accounts, harnessing 
company resources judiciously to foster revenue growth and ensure unparalleled customer 
satisfac tion, thus solidifying the company's reputation as a trusted partner of choice in the 
marketplace . 
• Implemented and meticulously monitored key performance indicators (KPIs) pertaining to order 
forecast accuracy, win rate, and pipeline efficiency, champion ing a culture of continuous improvement 
and relentless pursuit of optimal performance . 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2 Oct 15 – June 17  (Ford Credit Europe ) 
Risk Credit Analyst  
Ford Credit Europe Bank plc is a wholly owned subsidiary of Ford Mot or Company and offers Ford’s franchised 
Dealer network a variety of wholesale au tomot ive financial products and services through the Ford Credit brand 
name.  Dealer and Fleet Credit Analysts are responsible for the full cycle credit management of a Dealer l ending 
portfolio of low to medium risk/complexity Dealers, representing the Ford  Bran d.  
Main Responsibilities :  
• Building, developing and managing funding relationships with senior Dealer management (e.g. Managing 
Director/Finance Director/Operations Direc tor) of low to medium risk/complexity Ford Dealers  
• Carry out desk based customer  facing credit assessments of low to medium risk/complexity Dealers, 
reviewing financial and non -financial data at a company, sector level.  
• Prepare and propose recommendations on credit proposals and credit reviews for decision by Credit 
Committees, ensuri ng cl ear, concise, business focused assessment for fully informed Credit decision 
making, including all necessary compliance checks (OFAC, PE
